item.title: A Venturing Model
item.description:
::: entry-content I’ve been wanting to post on this for a while now. It’s a snapshot of my latest understanding of the venturing process. It’s early draft and the writing below is pretty much stream of consciousness but I’m being drawn to just get it out:
{#BLOGGER_PHOTO_ID_5084291506952726098 border=“0” decoding=“async” style=“margin: 0px auto 10px; display: block; text-align: center; cursor: pointer;”}{onblur=“try {parent.deselectBloggerImageGracefully();} catch(e) {}”}
We’re in an interesting point in history where there is a transition from a mindset based on seeking to understand the smallest components of things (reductionist thinking, command and control models, ’the great clockwork’, world/problems as ‘complicated’) toward a mindset that looks at systems in terms of the relationships/context in order to understand them (systems, ecological, ‘complex’).
